xaikit.explainers package¶

Submodules¶

xaikit.explainers.breakdown module¶

xaikit.explainers.breakdown.breakdown(estimator, x, x0, features=None)¶

Creates data for a breakdown plot.

Parameters

  • estimator – An estimator compatible with the scikit-learn Estimator interface.

  • x – An n x m feature matrix of n observations of m variables.

  • x0 – A single observation for which the breakdown plot is to be constructed.

  • features – Controls which features are included in the result. This argument controls both the order in which features appear in the plot, as well as which features are bundled together under the “remaining features” label.

xaikit.explainers.breakdown.contributions_along_path(predict, x, x0, feature_path)¶

Implementation of the breakdown logic. Separated so that it can be re-used in SHAP calculations.

xaikit.explainers.ceteris_paribus module¶

xaikit.explainers.ceteris_paribus.ceteris_paribus(estimator, x, feature, values, relative=False)¶

Creates a “ceteris paribus” data for a given feature.

Computes predictions of an estimator for a subset values of possible values of a given feature feature while keeping the remaining features fixed.

Parameters

  • estimator – A fitted estimator.

  • ndarray or DataFrame, shape (1, n_features) (x) – A single observation used as the basis for computation.

  • feature – A feature to be varied.

  • values – Values to be admitted by the feature.

  • relative – If True will return differences between predictions for a perturbed observation and the baseline prediction for x. Default: False.

xaikit.explainers.shap module¶

xaikit.explainers.shap.shap(estimator, x, x0, features=None, n_permutations=10, seed=42)¶

Calculates Shapley Additive Explanations (SHAP) contributions.

Parameters

  • estimator – An estimator compatible with the scikit-learn Estimator interface.

  • x – An n x m feature matrix of n observations of m variables.

  • x0 – A single observation for which the breakdown plot is to be constructed.

  • features – Controls which features are included in the result. This argument controls both the order in which features appear in the plot, as well as which features are bundled together.

  • n_permutations – Number of permutations to compute the SHAP values.

  • seed – Seed number for the permutations generator.
